intro: Vismia cavalcantei var. obidensis, commonly known as the Obidos vismia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are clustered in complex structures called cyathia, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
